keyMoments.title: Hajrudin Declares His Goal
keyMoments.description: Hajrudin appears in Block C of the Corrida Colosseum, easily defeating numerous competitors and declaring his intention to win the Mera Mera no Mi and become king of the giants.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of Hajrudin as a powerful giant warrior from Elbaf with royal ambitions.
keyMoments.quote: I will wield the Mera Mera no Mi and become the king of the giants!

keyMoments.title: Hajrudin Crushes Lucy and Ucy
keyMoments.description: Hajrudin crushes both Luffy and Ucy with his massive fist when they accidentally run into his leg, demonstrating his overwhelming strength.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Hajrudin as a formidable opponent in the tournament.

keyMoments.title: Hajrudin Defeated by Lucy
keyMoments.description: Hajrudin is knocked out by a single Haki-infused punch from Luffy (Lucy), shocking the entire colosseum crowd.
keyMoments.significance: First defeat for the giant warrior, teaching him humility and respect for Luffy.

abilities.description: As a giant from Elbaf, Hajrudin possesses incredible physical strength capable of crushing multiple opponents at once.

relationships.description: Hajrudin initially fights against Luffy (as Lucy) in Block C but is defeated, later becoming his ally.

evolutionMoments.description: Hajrudin fights and is defeated by Luffy in the Corrida Colosseum.

reveals.information: Wants to become king of the giants

keyMoments.title: Luffy Tames Fighting Bull Ucy
keyMoments.description: The Fighting Bull known as Ucy is tamed and befriended by Luffy, who rides him around the colosseum arena.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the bond between Luffy and Ucy that motivates Luffy's anger when the bull is injured.

keyMoments.title: Ucy Crushed by Hajrudin
keyMoments.description: Ucy is crushed by Hajrudin's massive fist, rendered unconscious and having his left horn broken.
keyMoments.significance: Triggers Luffy's protective rage and his decisive victory over Hajrudin.

abilities.description: As a fighting bull, Ucy can charge with tremendous force, eliminating multiple combatants.

relationships.description: Ucy is befriended and tamed by Luffy, forming a bond strong enough to anger Luffy when the bull is hurt.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy befriends and names the Fighting Bull 'Ucy'.

reveals.information: Known as the 'Colosseum's Grim Reaper' with 21 death row prisoner victories

keyMoments.title: Luffy Tames Ucy
keyMoments.description: Luffy befriends and tames the Fighting Bull Ucy, demonstrating his natural ability to connect with animals.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's compassionate nature and sets up his protective rage later in the episode.
keyMoments.quote: Hey there, Ucy! Let's do this together!

keyMoments.title: Luffy Defeats Hajrudin
keyMoments.description: Using Gear Second and Armament Haki, Luffy defeats the giant Hajrudin with a single punch, shocking the crowd.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's mastery of Haki and his emotional fighting style driven by protecting friends.

relationships.description: Luffy quickly befriends the Fighting Bull Ucy, demonstrating his ability to connect with any creature.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy tames and nicknames the Fighting Bull 'Ucy'.

keyMoments.title: Giolla Transforms the Crew
keyMoments.description: Giolla uses her Ato Ato no Mi powers to transform Nami, Brook, Chopper, and Momonosuke into abstract art forms.
keyMoments.significance: Major display of Giolla's devil fruit abilities in combat.
keyMoments.quote: You're all pieces of art now!

keyMoments.title: Giolla Transforms the Thousand Sunny
keyMoments.description: Giolla uses her powers to transform the Thousand Sunny into abstract art, making it unable to sail.
keyMoments.significance: Escalates the threat by trapping the Straw Hats in Dressrosa.

reveals.information: Plans to capture Momonosuke and trap the Straw Hats in Dressrosa

keyMoments.title: Bellamy Ordered to Kill Luffy
keyMoments.description: Bellamy receives orders from Diamante to assassinate Luffy as a test of loyalty to Doflamingo, but is conflicted about the order.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a moral dilemma for Bellamy between loyalty to Doflamingo and respect for Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Ricky Meets Rebecca
keyMoments.description: The injured Ricky encounters Rebecca in the medical area and seems to remember her as a child, hinting at a deeper connection.
keyMoments.significance: Foreshadows the revelation that Ricky is actually King Riku, Rebecca's grandfather.

relationships.description: Ricky recognizes Rebecca, hinting at his true identity as her grandfather King Riku.

evolutionMoments.description: Ricky seems to remember Rebecca as a child when they meet in the medical area.

keyMoments.title: Rebecca Meets Ricky
keyMoments.description: Rebecca encounters the injured Ricky and insists he receive treatment, not yet realizing his true identity.
keyMoments.significance: Continues building the mystery around Ricky's identity and his connection to Rebecca.
